OK, apologies in advance if this has been asked before - I searched
around =
the forum here and could not find an answer to my question:

I've noticed t=
hat if I don't supply the optional string argument to
many (perhaps all) of=
 Junit's assert methods, I get an error message
that looks like this:
[juni=
t] null
[junit] junit.framework.AssertionFailedError

I find this to be con=
fusing.  However, if I include the optional
string argument, then that mess=
age is displayed in the output.
I have a very high opinion of the Junit fra=
mework and find it hard to
believe that the null message is standard behavi=
or.  It feels so
clunky, almost as if Junit does not check to see if the op=
tional
argument was passed or not.  My guess is that there's a property
som=
ewhere which allows me disable the null error but I can't find it.
 My othe=
r option is to just add a string argument to all of the
asserts in all of m=
y unit tests (at this point, not that many although
it would still be a pai=
n and would probably take me at least a few hours).
Any and all help is app=
reciated.
